name: SL Logo Slider
author: Iwan Prasetiyo

sections.description:
A WordPress Image Logo slider based on Slick jquery to display image logo on footer, post, page or theme. It’s an easy for usage, simple & responsive, which looks awesome in front page your theme or every single theme.

Features

  • Very simple setting configuration
  • Default setting for logo is 5 slides
  • Fully responsive
  • Unlimited images to uploaded
  • Custom link for each images redirect to another site
  • Custom title for the logo slide
  • Supported in all major browsers
  • Support arrows navigation and dots arrows

Usage

https://github.com/iwane021/sl-logo-slider
sections.installation:
Installing the plugins is very simple you can downloaded or just like installing other WordPress plugins. If you don’t know how to install plugins, please look at the option below:

  • From your WordPress dashboard go to Plugins > Add New.
  • Search for SL Logo Slider in Search Plugins box.
  • Find the WordPress Plugin named SL Logo Slider by Iwan Prasetiyo.
  • Click Install Now to install the SL Logo Slider Plugin.
  • The plugin will begin to download and install.
  • Now just click Activate to activate the plugin.
  • Place “apply_filters( ‘filter_sls_logo’, ”);” in your front page of templates.

If you still need help. visit WordPress codex
sections.faq:
Do you have questions or issues with SL Logo Slider? Ask for support here.

Installation Instructions

Installing the plugins is very simple you can downloaded or just like installing other WordPress plugins. If you don’t know how to install plugins, please look at the option below:

  • From your WordPress dashboard go to Plugins > Add New.
  • Search for SL Logo Slider in Search Plugins box.
  • Find the WordPress Plugin named SL Logo Slider by Iwan Prasetiyo.
  • Click Install Now to install the SL Logo Slider Plugin.
  • The plugin will begin to download and install.
  • Now just click Activate to activate the plugin.
  • Place “apply_filters( ‘filter_sls_logo’, ”);” in your front page of templates.

If you still need help. visit WordPress codex
